verses.verse: O LORD <WH3068> God, <WH410> to whom vengeance <WH5360> belongeth; O God, <WH410> to whom vengeance <WH5360> belongeth, show thyself. <WH3313>
Lift up thyself, <WH5375> thou judge <WH8199> of the earth: <WH776> render <WH7725> a reward <WH1576> to <WH5921> the proud. <WH1343>
LORD, <WH3068> how long <WH5704> <WH4970> shall the wicked, <WH7563> how long <WH5704> <WH4970> shall the wicked <WH7563> triumph? <WH5937>
How long shall they utter <WH5042> and speak <WH1696> hard things? <WH6277> and all <WH3605> the workers <WH6466> of iniquity <WH205> boast themselves? <WH559>
They break in pieces <WH1792> thy people, <WH5971> O LORD, <WH3068> and afflict <WH6031> thine heritage. <WH5159>
They slay <WH2026> the widow <WH490> and the stranger, <WH1616> and murder <WH7523> the fatherless. <WH3490>
Yet they say, <WH559> The LORD <WH3050> shall not <WH3808> see, <WH7200> neither <WH3808> shall the God <WH430> of Jacob <WH3290> regard <WH995> it.
Understand, <WH995> ye brutish <WH1197> among the people: <WH5971> and ye fools, <WH3684> when <WH4970> will ye be wise? <WH7919>
He that planted <WH5193> the ear, <WH241> shall he not <WH3808> hear? <WH8085> he that formed <WH3335> the eye, <WH5869> shall he not <WH3808> see? <WH5027>
He that chastiseth <WH3256> the heathen, <WH1471> shall not <WH3808> he correct? <WH3198> he that teacheth <WH3925> man <WH120> knowledge, <WH1847> shall not he know?
The LORD <WH3068> knoweth <WH3045> the thoughts <WH4284> of man, <WH120> that <WH3588> they <WH1992> are vanity. <WH1892>
Blessed <WH835> is the man <WH1397> whom <WH834> thou chastenest, <WH3256> O LORD, <WH3050> and teachest <WH3925> him out of thy law; <WH4480> <WH8451>
That thou mayest give him rest <WH8252> from the days <WH4480> <WH3117> of adversity, <WH7451> until <WH5704> the pit <WH7845> be digged <WH3738> for the wicked. <WH7563>
For <WH3588> the LORD <WH3068> will not <WH3808> cast off <WH5203> his people, <WH5971> neither <WH3808> will he forsake <WH5800> his inheritance. <WH5159>
But <WH3588> judgment <WH4941> shall return <WH7725> unto <WH5704> righteousness: <WH6664> and all <WH3605> the upright <WH3477> in heart <WH3820> shall follow <WH310> it.
Who <WH4310> will rise up <WH6965> for me against <WH5973> the evildoers? <WH7489> or who <WH4310> will stand up <WH3320> for me against <WH5973> the workers <WH6466> of iniquity? <WH205>
Unless <WH3884> the LORD <WH3068> had been my help, <WH5833> my soul <WH5315> had almost <WH4592> dwelt <WH7931> in silence. <WH1745>
When <WH518> I said, <WH559> My foot <WH7272> slippeth; <WH4131> thy mercy, <WH2617> O LORD, <WH3068> held me up. <WH5582>
In the multitude <WH7230> of my thoughts <WH8312> within <WH7130> me thy comforts <WH8575> delight <WH8173> my soul. <WH5315>
Shall the throne <WH3678> of iniquity <WH1942> have fellowship <WH2266> with thee, which frameth <WH3335> mischief <WH5999> by <WH5921> a law? <WH2706>
They gather themselves together <WH1413> against <WH5921> the soul <WH5315> of the righteous, <WH6662> and condemn <WH7561> the innocent <WH5355> blood. <WH1818>
But the LORD <WH3068> is <WH1961> my defense; <WH4869> and my God <WH430> is the rock <WH6697> of my refuge. <WH4268>

And he shall bring <WH7725> upon <WH5921> them <WH853> their own iniquity, <WH205> and shall cut them off <WH6789> in their own wickedness; <WH7451> yea, the LORD <WH3068> our God <WH430> shall cut them off. <WH6789>
